stream_context.summary: Most of the stream was spent searching for a viable visual style for the new Ice Castle level while Kaze experimented live in Blender and the emulator; he also revealed off-stream work on a brand-new, assembly-written operating system for the N64.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is writing a completely new, assembly-only operating system for the N64 to replace Nintendo’s libultra and regain full low-level control.
development_findings.quote: We have been freed from the oppression that compilers have caused us.

development_findings.summary: The session focused on establishing an art style for the Ice Castle; countless texture, palette and geometry experiments were tried but none were accepted as final.
Fog will be disabled in the Ice Castle so vertex-alpha effects can be used for stronger contrast between deep blues and bright whites.
development_findings.quote: I think we need to give up on fog.

development_findings.summary: A new collision system has been implemented and is described as far more stable than the original Mario 64 one.
development_findings.quote: My new collision system is a lot more stable than the vanilla one.

development_findings.summary: Transparent materials are being avoided; the team is looking for opaque combiners that still read as ice (e.g., NF maps, multi-texturing, environment maps).
Procedural icicle placement via Blender geometry nodes was explored but deemed hard to maintain; viability depends on a solution Biobak can work with.
Despite heavier geometry, Kaze is confident the level can still hit 60 fps on real hardware.
development_findings.quote: This is still going to be 60 fps, I'm pretty sure.

development_findings.summary: Return to Yoshi’s Island will mirror Mario 64’s structure with 15 courses; Ice Castle is course 13.
development_findings.quote: This is the last quest 13 and there's gonna be 15 just like the original game.

context_findings.summary: Kaze lives in Canada, works at Gears for Breakfast as a programmer, and views Twitch income (~$50/month) as negligible.
context_findings.quote: I work at Gears for Breakfast.

context_findings.summary: He believes art should provoke strong emotion, even negative, but worries about backlash ('getting cancelled').
context_findings.quote: If I made a track like that, I would want to make you feel pure hatred.

context_findings.summary: He champions low-level, assembly-centric development and dislikes reliance on compilers.
Personal anecdote: Zeina jokingly shaves Kaze’s head whenever he forgets her 'daily birthday', illustrating their playful dynamic.
context_findings.quote: She said, Dude, Kaze, you are worthless … and then she just shaved me again.

context_findings.summary: Shows visible frustration with tooling (Restream login issues, broken controller) and with unsatisfactory art trials.

biobak.summary: Actively critiques the feasibility of proposed wall/spike designs; if Biobak deems a concept 'unworkable', Kaze abandons it.
biobak.quote: If Biobak says this is unworkable … then we can't just use it.

biobak.summary: Previously created an ice-shader reference Kaze intends to revisit and now promises a new idea for the Ice Castle visuals.

badub.summary: Composed two tracks for the hack, one earmarked for the Ice Castle and another for a space area; music predates current level work.
badub.quote: Fun fact. The dupe made two separate songs for us.

zeina.summary: Supplied several reference images that guided the early Ice Castle brainstorming.
Playful personal interaction (daily birthday ritual) occasionally interrupts development flow.

key_stories.title: Rewriting Libultra
key_stories.summary: Frustrated with Nintendo’s dated libraries, Kaze began building his own N64 OS in pure assembly.
key_stories.challenge: Libultra’s performance and structure 'suck' and restrict lower-level control.
key_stories.process: Researching hardware, learning correct assembly workflows, removing compiler dependencies.
key_stories.outcome: Core routines are working off-stream; Kaze plans to continue optimization after the stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm just gonna write a better one.

key_stories.title: The Elusive Ice Castle Look
key_stories.summary: A live, three-hour texture and geometry hunt failed to deliver a final style, exposing N64 limits and team dependencies.
key_stories.challenge: Current prototype 'looks like garbage' and fails to convey an icy castle without breaking hardware limits.
key_stories.process: Tried Frozen, Adventure Time, NF maps, hex tiles, icicle spikes, vertex-alpha tricks; consulted ChatGPT and chat; removed fog; attempted geometry-node scatter.
key_stories.outcome: Nothing approved; Biobak will devise a new approach off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: We need to brainstorm more, don't just fixate on the thing.

key_stories.title: Community Collab Burnout
key_stories.summary: Kaze cited another ROM-hack collab that stalled when volunteers dropped out.
key_stories.challenge: A volunteer claimed a level and then vanished, delaying the project.
key_stories.process: Remaining team had to pick up incomplete work, causing frustration.
key_stories.outcome: Serves as cautionary tale; influences Kaze’s insistence on workable, self-sustaining assets.
key_stories.key_quote: Trying to make people finish a thing in time is impossible.
